meanings.definition: A sound made by a sheep or calf.
meanings.sent1: The blee of the sheep echoed through the meadow.
meanings.sent2: I heard a soft blee coming from the barn.
meanings.sent3: The blee of the calf sounded like a tiny trumpet.
meanings.sent4: The blee of the sheep was a gentle lullaby in the night.
meanings.sent5: The blee of the calf was a sweet melody in the farmyard.

meanings.definition: To make a sound like a sheep or calf.
meanings.sent1: The little lamb would blee whenever it was hungry.
meanings.sent2: I tried to blee like a sheep, but it just sounded silly.
meanings.sent3: He likes to blee along with the animals at the petting zoo.
meanings.sent4: The toy sheep would blee when you squeezed it.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to blee convincingly for the farm scene.

meanings.sent1: There was a tiny blee on the white shirt.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a small blee on the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The blee on the painting made it look more authentic.
meanings.sent4: The blee on the map marked the location of the treasure.
meanings.sent5: The blee on the paper was barely noticeable.
